passages.text: Brazil | Healthcare Services
Rede D'Or Sao Luiz SA
Invite | Fireside Chat with Rede D'Or

We are hosting a virtual group meeting with Rede D'Or's CFO Otávio Lazcano on Thursday, September 11, 2025 at 10am ET | 11am BRT | 3pm BST. Rede D'Or is the biggest healthcare group in Brazil. It operates 76 hospitals, and oncology and diagnostic clinics. In 2023, it expanded to health insurance by acquiring SulAmerica, one of the main health insurers in the country. Register here

Rede D'Or Sao Luiz has a long- standing presence in Brazil's healthcare sector. Founded by Dr. Jorge Moll and beginning in 1977 as a diagnostic clinic in Rio de Janeiro, the company transitioned into hospital operations in 1998 and expanded rapidly through acquisitions and new developments. Today, it stands as Brazil's largest independent private hospital network, operating 75 hospitals and 61 oncology clinics, with over 106,000 accredited doctors across 14 metropolitan regions.

Rede D'Or evolved into an integrated and distinct healthcare company. Today, it also encompasses insurance, oncology, diagnostics, and research. The scale has enabled it to achieve operational efficiencies and to attract top- tier medical professionals, which in turn reinforce its brand reputation among patients and make it an essential partner for healthcare payers.

Its expansion strategy has been a blend of acquisitions and disciplined organic growth. M&As, with strong post- acquisition performance, offer returns on invested capital as high as greenfield projects. Following its IPO and excluding SulAmerica insurance revenues, the company has doubled revenues since 2020 (5- year CAGR of c. \(16\%\) ) driven by the addition of 5,392 beds, \(70\%\) of the 2020 base.

Growth ahead. Rede D'Or aims to add 1,660 beds, or \(16\%\) of the current base, by returning its utilization rates to historical levels. No further relevant investments are attached to the maturation of these beds. In addition, Rede D'Or has a pipeline of 3,203 additional beds planned through 2028, representing \(25\%\) growth over its current capacity - mostly brownfield, which historically yield a \(40\%\) ROIC.

Strategic moves. The acquisition of SulAmerica has proven to be correct. Initially unexpected and feared by the market, it enhances Rede D'Or's organic growth capabilities. Moreover, having returned to profitability after COVID turmoil and claims ratio adjustments, it is now positioned to grow. Besides that, the joint venture with Bradesco Saúde turns the second- biggest healthcare insurer player into an ally and its beneficiary base would considerably help Rede D'Or to operationalize existing and to- be- added beds.

Upside potential. For the hospital segment, upside could come from new project announcements, faster- than- expected bed utilization, and sustained ticket growth. For America, stronger beneficiary growth and stable claims ratios would reinforce its value in a low- differentiation market.]

The invitee. Otávio Lazcano has over 30 years of corporate experience. He served as Treasurer at Aracruz Celulose (currently Suzano), as CFO at CSN, executive officer at Prumo Logistica, and partner and investment manager at BTG Pactual. He holds an MBA from Fundação Dom Cabral, and a BSc in Economics from Faculdades Cândido Mendes. Otávio Lazcano has been in Rede D'Or since 2015.

Rede D'Or Sao Luiz SA

Rede D'Or Sao Luiz SA is the biggest health care group in Brazil. It operates 75 hospitals and other medical facilities, including oncology and diagnostic exams. In 2023, it expanded to the health insurance business by acquiring Sulamerica, one of the main health insurers in the country. The company was founded by Jorge Moll in 1977 and is headquartered in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

Our price target is set using a DDM approach. Key risks include macroeconomic conditions, affecting GDP growth, unemployment rate, inflation, and interest rates; changes in the healthcare regulatory environment; fiercer underwriting competition with health insurers; fiercer competition with hospital providers; worsening financial situation of health insurers; and changes in the Brazilian tax and fiscal regime ch
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Antonio Pedro Cardoso holds a long equity position in Rede D'Or Sao Luiz S.A. Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries expect to receive or intend to seek compensation for investment banking services from Companhia Siderurgica Nacional (CSN) within the next three months. Within the past twelve months, Companhia Siderurgica Nacional (CSN) has been a client of Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries and investment banking services are being or have been provided. Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries is acting as a manager or co- manager in the underwriting or placement of securities for Companhia Siderurgica Nacional (CSN) or one of its affiliates. Within the past 12 months, Jefferies Financial Group Inc., its affiliates or subsidiaries has received compensation from investment banking services from Companhia Siderurgica Nacional (CSN).

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stocks selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
